comments:

file" on an instance variable. It didn't work and I got the following 
exception (using build I20051102-1600)

The rename in file proposal must ensure it sets up linked mode correctly -
perhaps the AST was not up to date when it computed the ranges?
I'm pretty sure that we got a AST that was not up to date.

>I'm pretty sure that we got a AST that was not up to date.
Why do you think so? And how should that have happened?

Michael, can you reproduce this?
No, I haven't been able to reproduce it.

I'm suspecting the AST being not up-to-date because I see similar problems quite
often in 3.1: Quick fix can't compute any proposals or mark occurrence
highlighting strange regions. On save everything works again. Unfortunatly I
don't have this reproducable. Maybe this has to do with the fact that we can
miss reconciles and that having the new possibility to get the AST when
listening to deltas will help.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 67965 ***
